intro: Artemisia vulgaris var. californica, commonly known as California mugwort, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It features silver-gray, aromatic foliage with finely divided leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of tiny, white hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in panicles during the summer months. It thrives in dry, well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. Due to its medicinal and aromatic properties, it has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
